domains.description: Console domain defines methods and events for interaction with the JavaScript console. Console collects messages created by means of the JavaScript Console API. One needs to enable this domain using enable command in order to start receiving the console messages. Browser collects messages issued while console domain is not enabled as well and reports them using messageAdded notification upon enabling.

types.description: Unique request identifier. FIXME: Duplicate of Network.RequestId <https://webkit.org/b/125664> Web Inspector: FIX Type Dependency Issues
Unique DOM node identifier. FIXME: Duplicate of DOM.NodeId <https://webkit.org/b/125664> Web Inspector: FIX Type Dependency Issues

properties.name: line
properties.description: Line number in the resource that generated this message.

properties.name: column
properties.description: Column number on the line in the resource that generated this message.

properties.name: parameters
properties.description: Message parameters in case of the formatted message.

properties.name: stackTrace
properties.description: JavaScript stack trace for assertions and error messages.

properties.name: networkRequestId
properties.description: Identifier of the network request associated with this message.

types.description: Stack entry for console errors and assertions.
Call frames for assertions or error messages.

commands.name: enable
commands.description: Enables console domain, sends the messages collected so far to the client by means of the messageAdded notification.

commands.name: disable
commands.description: Disables console domain, prevents further console messages from being reported to the client.

commands.name: clearMessages
commands.description: Clears console messages collected in the browser.

commands.name: setMonitoringXHREnabled

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: Monitoring enabled state.

commands.description: Toggles monitoring of XMLHttpRequest. If true, console will receive messages upon each XHR issued.

commands.name: addInspectedNode

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: DOM node id to be accessible by means of $x command line API.

commands.description: Enables console to refer to the node with given id via $x (see Command Line API for more details $x functions).

events.name: messageAdded

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: Console message that has been added.

events.description: Issued when new console message is added.

events.name: messageRepeatCountUpdated

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: New repeat count value.

events.description: Issued when subsequent message(s) are equal to the previous one(s).

events.name: messagesCleared
events.description: Issued when console is cleared. This happens either upon clearMessages command or after page navigation.

domains.description: Debugger domain exposes JavaScript debugging capabilities. It allows setting and removing breakpoints, stepping through execution, exploring stack traces, etc.

properties.name: scriptId
properties.description: Script identifier as reported in the Debugger.scriptParsed.

properties.name: data
properties.description: Data associated with this breakpoint type (e.g. for type "eval" this is the JavaScript string to evalulate).

properties.name: id
properties.description: A frontend-assigned identifier for this breakpoint action.

types.description: Action to perform when a breakpoint is triggered.

properties.name: condition
properties.description: Expression to use as a breakpoint condition. When specified, debugger will only stop on the breakpoint if this expression evaluates to true.

properties.name: actions
properties.description: Actions to perform automatically when the breakpoint is triggered.

properties.name: autoContinue
properties.description: Automatically continue after hitting this breakpoint and running actions.

types.description: Extra options that modify breakpoint behavior.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of the function. Not present for anonymous functions.

properties.name: displayName
properties.description: Display name of the function(specified in 'displayName' property on the function object).

properties.name: inferredName
properties.description: Name of the function inferred from its initial assignment.

properties.name: callFrameId
properties.description: Call frame identifier. This identifier is only valid while the virtual machine is paused.

properties.name: functionName
properties.description: Name of the JavaScript function called on this call frame.

properties.name: scopeChain
properties.description: Scope chain for this call frame.

types.description: JavaScript call frame. Array of call frames form the call stack.

properties.name: object
properties.description: Object representing the scope. For global and with scopes it represents the actual object; for the rest of the scopes, it is artificial transient object enumerating scope variables as its properties.

types.description: A sample collected by evaluating a probe breakpoint action.

properties.name: probeId
properties.description: Identifier of the probe breakpoint action that created the sample.

properties.name: batchId
properties.description: A batch identifier which is the same for all samples taken at the same breakpoint hit.

properties.name: timestamp
properties.description: Timestamp of when the sample was taken.

commands.name: enable
commands.description: Enables debugger for the given page. Clients should not assume that the debugging has been enabled until the result for this command is received.

commands.name: disable
commands.description: Disables debugger for given page.

commands.name: setBreakpointsActive

parameters.name: active
parameters.description: New value for breakpoints active state.

commands.description: Activates / deactivates all breakpoints on the page.

commands.name: setBreakpointByUrl

parameters.name: lineNumber
parameters.description: Line number to set breakpoint at.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL of the resources to set breakpoint on.

parameters.name: urlRegex
parameters.description: Regex pattern for the URLs of the resources to set breakpoints on. Either url or urlRegex must be specified.

parameters.name: columnNumber
parameters.description: Offset in the line to set breakpoint at.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: Options to apply to this breakpoint to modify its behavior.

returns.name: breakpointId
returns.description: Id of the created breakpoint for further reference.

returns.name: locations
returns.description: List of the locations this breakpoint resolved into upon addition.

commands.description: Sets JavaScript breakpoint at given location specified either by URL or URL regex. Once this command is issued, all existing parsed scripts will have breakpoints resolved and returned in locations property. Further matching script parsing will result in subsequent breakpointResolved events issued. This logical breakpoint will survive page reloads.

commands.name: setBreakpoint

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Location to set breakpoint in.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: Options to apply to this breakpoint to modify its behavior.

returns.name: breakpointId
returns.description: Id of the created breakpoint for further reference.

commands.description: Sets JavaScript breakpoint at a given location.

commands.name: removeBreakpoint
commands.description: Removes JavaScript breakpoint.

commands.name: continueToLocation

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Location to continue to.

commands.description: Continues execution until specific location is reached.

commands.name: stepOver
commands.description: Steps over the statement.

commands.name: stepInto
commands.description: Steps into the function call.

commands.name: stepOut
commands.description: Steps out of the function call.

commands.name: pause
commands.description: Stops on the next JavaScript statement.

commands.name: resume
commands.description: Resumes JavaScript execution.

commands.name: searchInContent

parameters.name: scriptId
parameters.description: Id of the script to search in.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: String to search for.

parameters.name: caseSensitive
parameters.description: If true, search is case sensitive.

parameters.name: isRegex
parameters.description: If true, treats string parameter as regex.

commands.description: Searches for given string in script content.

commands.name: getScriptSource

parameters.name: scriptId
parameters.description: Id of the script to get source for.

commands.description: Returns source for the script with given id.

commands.name: getFunctionDetails

parameters.name: functionId
parameters.description: Id of the function to get location for.

commands.description: Returns detailed informtation on given function.

commands.name: setPauseOnExceptions

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Pause on exceptions mode.

commands.description: Defines pause on exceptions state. Can be set to stop on all exceptions, uncaught exceptions or no exceptions. Initial pause on exceptions state is none.

commands.name: evaluateOnCallFrame

parameters.name: callFrameId
parameters.description: Call frame identifier to evaluate on.

parameters.name: expression
parameters.description: Expression to evaluate.

parameters.name: objectGroup
parameters.description: String object group name to put result into (allows rapid releasing resulting object handles using releaseObjectGroup).

parameters.name: includeCommandLineAPI
parameters.description: Specifies whether command line API should be available to the evaluated expression, defaults to false.

parameters.name: doNotPauseOnExceptionsAndMuteConsole
parameters.description: Specifies whether evaluation should stop on exceptions and mute console. Overrides setPauseOnException state.

parameters.name: returnByValue
parameters.description: Whether the result is expected to be a JSON object that should be sent by value.

parameters.name: generatePreview
parameters.description: Whether preview should be generated for the result.

returns.name: result
returns.description: Object wrapper for the evaluation result.

returns.name: wasThrown
returns.description: True if the result was thrown during the evaluation.

commands.description: Evaluates expression on a given call frame.

commands.name: setOverlayMessage

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: Overlay message to display when paused in debugger.

commands.description: Sets overlay message.

events.name: globalObjectCleared
events.description: Called when global has been cleared and debugger client should reset its state. Happens upon navigation or reload.

events.name: scriptParsed

parameters.name: scriptId
parameters.description: Identifier of the script parsed.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL or name of the script parsed (if any).

parameters.name: startLine
parameters.description: Line offset of the script within the resource with given URL (for script tags).

parameters.name: startColumn
parameters.description: Column offset of the script within the resource with given URL.

parameters.name: endLine
parameters.description: Last line of the script.

parameters.name: endColumn
parameters.description: Length of the last line of the script.

parameters.name: isContentScript
parameters.description: Determines whether this script is a user extension script.

parameters.name: sourceMapURL
parameters.description: URL of source map associated with script (if any).

parameters.name: hasSourceURL
parameters.description: True, if this script has sourceURL.

events.description: Fired when virtual machine parses script. This event is also fired for all known and uncollected scripts upon enabling debugger.

events.name: scriptFailedToParse

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL of the script that failed to parse.

parameters.name: scriptSource
parameters.description: Source text of the script that failed to parse.

parameters.name: startLine
parameters.description: Line offset of the script within the resource.

parameters.name: errorLine
parameters.description: Line with error.

parameters.name: errorMessage
parameters.description: Parse error message.

events.description: Fired when virtual machine fails to parse the script.

events.name: breakpointResolved

parameters.name: breakpointId
parameters.description: Breakpoint unique identifier.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Actual breakpoint location.

events.description: Fired when breakpoint is resolved to an actual script and location.

events.name: paused

parameters.name: callFrames
parameters.description: Call stack the virtual machine stopped on.

parameters.name: reason
parameters.description: Pause reason.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: Object containing break-specific auxiliary properties.

events.description: Fired when the virtual machine stopped on breakpoint or exception or any other stop criteria.

events.name: resumed
events.description: Fired when the virtual machine resumed execution.

events.name: didSampleProbe
events.description: Fires when a new probe sample is collected.

parameters.name: sample
parameters.description: A collected probe sample.

events.name: playBreakpointActionSound
events.description: Fired when a "sound" breakpoint action is triggered on a breakpoint.

parameters.name: breakpointActionId
parameters.description: Breakpoint action identifier.

domains.description: Exposes generic types to be used by any domain.

commands.name: enable
commands.description: Enables inspector domain notifications.

commands.name: disable
commands.description: Disables inspector domain notifications.

types.description: CPU Profile call info. Holds time information for a specific call that happened on a node.

properties.name: totalTime
properties.description: Total execution time for the call.

types.description: CPU Profile node. Holds callsite information, execution statistics and child nodes.

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this call site.

properties.name: rootNodes
properties.description: Top level nodes in the stack.

domains.description: Runtime domain exposes JavaScript runtime by means of remote evaluation and mirror objects. Evaluation results are returned as mirror object that expose object type, string representation and unique identifier that can be used for further object reference. Original objects are maintained in memory unless they are either explicitly released or are released along with the other objects in their object group.

types.description: Mirror object referencing original JavaScript object.

properties.name: subtype
properties.description: Object subtype hint. Specified for object type values only.

properties.name: className
properties.description: Object class (constructor) name. Specified for object type values only.

properties.name: value
properties.description: Remote object value (in case of primitive values or JSON values if it was requested).

types.description: Object containing abbreviated remote object value.

properties.name: lossless
properties.description: Determines whether preview is lossless (contains all information of the original object).

properties.name: overflow
properties.description: True iff some of the properties of the original did not fit.

properties.name: subtype
properties.description: Object subtype hint. Specified for object type values only.

properties.name: value
properties.description: The value associated with the property.

properties.name: writable
properties.description: True if the value associated with the property may be changed (data descriptors only).

properties.name: get
properties.description: A function which serves as a getter for the property, or undefined if there is no getter (accessor descriptors only).

properties.name: set
properties.description: A function which serves as a setter for the property, or undefined if there is no setter (accessor descriptors only).

properties.name: configurable
properties.description: True if the type of this property descriptor may be changed and if the property may be deleted from the corresponding object.

properties.name: enumerable
properties.description: True if this property shows up during enumeration of the properties on the corresponding object.

properties.name: wasThrown
properties.description: True if the result was thrown during the evaluation.

properties.name: isOwn
properties.description: True if the property is owned for the object.

types.description: Object internal property descriptor. This property isn't normally visible in JavaScript code.

properties.name: value
properties.description: The value associated with the property.

types.description: Represents function call argument. Either remote object id objectId or primitive value or neither of (for undefined) them should be specified.
Unique frame identifier. FIXME: Duplicate of Network.FrameId <https://webkit.org/b/125664> Web Inspector: FIX Type Dependency Issues

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique id of the execution context. It can be used to specify in which execution context script evaluation should be performed.

properties.name: isPageContext
properties.description: True if this is a context where inpspected web page scripts run. False if it is a content script isolated context.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Human readable name describing given context.

types.description: Syntax error type: "none" for no error, "irrecoverable" for unrecoverable errors, "unterminated-literal" for when there is an unterminated literal, "recoverable" for when the expression is unfinished but valid so far.
Range of an error in source code.

commands.name: parse

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: Source code to parse.

returns.name: range
returns.description: Range in the source where the error occurred.

commands.description: Parses JavaScript source code for errors.

commands.name: evaluate

parameters.name: expression
parameters.description: Expression to evaluate.

parameters.name: objectGroup
parameters.description: Symbolic group name that can be used to release multiple objects.

parameters.name: includeCommandLineAPI
parameters.description: Determines whether Command Line API should be available during the evaluation.

parameters.name: doNotPauseOnExceptionsAndMuteConsole
parameters.description: Specifies whether evaluation should stop on exceptions and mute console. Overrides setPauseOnException state.

parameters.name: contextId
parameters.description: Specifies in which isolated context to perform evaluation. Each content script lives in an isolated context and this parameter may be used to specify one of those contexts. If the parameter is omitted or 0 the evaluation will be performed in the context of the inspected page.

parameters.name: returnByValue
parameters.description: Whether the result is expected to be a JSON object that should be sent by value.

parameters.name: generatePreview
parameters.description: Whether preview should be generated for the result.

returns.name: wasThrown
returns.description: True if the result was thrown during the evaluation.

commands.description: Evaluates expression on global object.

commands.name: callFunctionOn

parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: Identifier of the object to call function on.

parameters.name: functionDeclaration
parameters.description: Declaration of the function to call.

parameters.name: arguments
parameters.description: Call arguments. All call arguments must belong to the same JavaScript world as the target object.

parameters.name: doNotPauseOnExceptionsAndMuteConsole
parameters.description: Specifies whether function call should stop on exceptions and mute console. Overrides setPauseOnException state.

parameters.name: returnByValue
parameters.description: Whether the result is expected to be a JSON object which should be sent by value.

parameters.name: generatePreview
parameters.description: Whether preview should be generated for the result.

returns.name: wasThrown
returns.description: True if the result was thrown during the evaluation.

commands.description: Calls function with given declaration on the given object. Object group of the result is inherited from the target object.

commands.name: getProperties

parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: Identifier of the object to return properties for.

parameters.name: ownProperties
parameters.description: If true, returns properties belonging only to the element itself, not to its prototype chain.

commands.description: Returns properties of a given object. Object group of the result is inherited from the target object.

commands.name: releaseObject

parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: Identifier of the object to release.

commands.description: Releases remote object with given id.

commands.name: releaseObjectGroup

parameters.name: objectGroup
parameters.description: Symbolic object group name.

commands.description: Releases all remote objects that belong to a given group.

commands.name: enable
commands.description: Enables reporting of execution contexts creation by means of executionContextCreated event. When the reporting gets enabled the event will be sent immediately for each existing execution context.

commands.name: disable
commands.description: Disables reporting of execution contexts creation.

events.name: executionContextCreated

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: A newly created execution contex.

events.description: Issued when new execution context is created.

commands.name: getFramesWithManifests

returns.name: frameIds
returns.description: Array of frame identifiers with manifest urls for each frame containing a document associated with some application cache.

commands.description: Returns array of frame identifiers with manifest urls for each frame containing a document associated with some application cache.

commands.name: enable
commands.description: Enables application cache domain notifications.

commands.name: getManifestForFrame

parameters.name: frameId
parameters.description: Identifier of the frame containing document whose manifest is retrieved.

returns.name: manifestURL
returns.description: Manifest URL for document in the given frame.

commands.description: Returns manifest URL for document in the given frame.

commands.name: getApplicationCacheForFrame

parameters.name: frameId
parameters.description: Identifier of the frame containing document whose application cache is retrieved.

returns.name: applicationCache
returns.description: Relevant application cache data for the document in given frame.

commands.description: Returns relevant application cache data for the document in given frame.

parameters.name: frameId
parameters.description: Identifier of the frame containing document whose application cache updated status.

parameters.name: manifestURL
parameters.description: Manifest URL.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Updated application cache status.

domains.description: This domain exposes CSS read/write operations. All CSS objects, like stylesheets, rules, and styles, have an associated id used in subsequent operations on the related object. Each object type has a specific id structure, and those are not interchangeable between objects of different kinds. CSS objects can be loaded using the get*ForNode() calls (which accept a DOM node id). Alternatively, a client can discover all the existing stylesheets with the getAllStyleSheets() method and subsequently load the required stylesheet contents using the getStyleSheet[Text]() methods.

properties.name: ordinal
properties.description: The style ordinal within the stylesheet.

types.description: This object identifies a CSS style in a unique way.

Stylesheet type: "user" for user stylesheets, "user-agent" for user-agent stylesheets, "inspector" for stylesheets created by the inspector (i.e. those holding the "via inspector" rules), "regular" for regular stylesheets.

properties.name: ordinal
properties.description: The rule ordinal within the stylesheet.

types.description: This object identifies a CSS rule in a unique way.

properties.name: matches
properties.description: Matches of CSS rules applicable to the pseudo style.

types.description: CSS rule collection for a single pseudo style.

properties.name: inlineStyle
properties.description: The ancestor node's inline style, if any, in the style inheritance chain.

properties.name: matchedCSSRules
properties.description: Matches of CSS rules matching the ancestor node in the style inheritance chain.

types.description: CSS rule collection for a single pseudo style.

properties.name: matchingSelectors
properties.description: Matching selector indices in the rule's selectorList selectors (0-based).

types.description: Match data for a CSS rule.

properties.name: range
properties.description: Rule selector range in the underlying resource (if available).

properties.name: style
properties.description: CSS style generated by the respective DOM attribute.

types.description: CSS style information for a DOM style attribute.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: Denotes whether the stylesheet is disabled.

properties.name: ruleId
properties.description: The CSS rule identifier (absent for user agent stylesheet and user-specified stylesheet rules).

properties.name: sourceURL
properties.description: Parent stylesheet resource URL (for regular rules).

properties.name: sourceLine
properties.description: Line ordinal of the rule selector start character in the resource.

properties.name: media
properties.description: Media list array (for rules involving media queries). The array enumerates media queries starting with the innermost one, going outwards.

properties.name: styleId
properties.description: The CSS style identifier (absent for attribute styles).

properties.name: shorthandEntries
properties.description: Computed values for all shorthands found in the style.

properties.name: range
properties.description: Style declaration range in the enclosing stylesheet (if available).

properties.name: width
properties.description: The effective "width" property value from this style.

properties.name: height
properties.description: The effective "height" property value from this style.

properties.name: implicit
properties.description: Whether the property is implicit (implies false if absent).

properties.name: text
properties.description: The full property text as specified in the style.

properties.name: parsedOk
properties.description: Whether the property is understood by the browser (implies true if absent).

properties.name: status
properties.description: The property status: "active" if the property is effective in the style, "inactive" if the property is overridden by a same-named property in this style later on, "disabled" if the property is disabled by the user, "style" (implied if absent) if the property is reported by the browser rather than by the CSS source parser.

properties.name: range
properties.description: The entire property range in the enclosing style declaration (if available).

types.description: CSS style effective visual dimensions and source offsets.

properties.name: source
properties.description: Source of the media query: "mediaRule" if specified by a @media rule, "importRule" if specified by an @import rule, "linkedSheet" if specified by a "media" attribute in a linked stylesheet's LINK tag, "inlineSheet" if specified by a "media" attribute in an inline stylesheet's STYLE tag.

properties.name: sourceURL
properties.description: URL of the document containing the media query description.

properties.name: sourceLine
properties.description: Line in the document containing the media query (not defined for the "stylesheet" source).

properties.name: regionOverset
properties.description: The "overset" attribute of a Named Flow.

types.description: This object represents a region that flows from a Named Flow.

properties.name: overset
properties.description: The "overset" attribute of a Named Flow.

properties.name: content
properties.description: An array of nodes that flow into the Named Flow.

properties.name: regions
properties.description: An array of regions associated with the Named Flow.

types.description: This object represents a Named Flow.

commands.name: enable
commands.description: Enables the CSS agent for the given page. Clients should not assume that the CSS agent has been enabled until the result of this command is received.

commands.name: disable
commands.description: Disables the CSS agent for the given page.

commands.name: getMatchedStylesForNode

parameters.name: includePseudo
parameters.description: Whether to include pseudo styles (default: true).

parameters.name: includeInherited
parameters.description: Whether to include inherited styles (default: true).

returns.name: matchedCSSRules
returns.description: CSS rules matching this node, from all applicable stylesheets.

returns.name: pseudoElements
returns.description: Pseudo style matches for this node.

returns.name: inherited
returns.description: A chain of inherited styles (from the immediate node parent up to the DOM tree root).

commands.description: Returns requested styles for a DOM node identified by nodeId.

commands.name: getInlineStylesForNode

returns.name: inlineStyle
returns.description: Inline style for the specified DOM node.

returns.name: attributesStyle
returns.description: Attribute-defined element style (e.g. resulting from "width=20 height=100%").

commands.description: Returns the styles defined inline (explicitly in the "style" attribute and implicitly, using DOM attributes) for a DOM node identified by nodeId.

commands.name: getComputedStyleForNode

returns.name: computedStyle
returns.description: Computed style for the specified DOM node.

commands.description: Returns the computed style for a DOM node identified by nodeId.

commands.name: getAllStyleSheets

returns.name: headers
returns.description: Descriptor entries for all available stylesheets.

commands.description: Returns metainfo entries for all known stylesheets.

commands.name: getStyleSheet
commands.description: Returns stylesheet data for the specified styleSheetId.

commands.name: getStyleSheetText
commands.description: Returns the current textual content and the URL for a stylesheet.

commands.name: setStyleSheetText
commands.description: Sets the new stylesheet text, thereby invalidating all existing CSSStyleId's and CSSRuleId's contained by this stylesheet.

commands.name: setStyleText

returns.name: style
returns.description: The resulting style after the text modification.

commands.description: Sets the new text for the respective style.

commands.name: setRuleSelector

returns.name: rule
returns.description: The resulting rule after the selector modification.

commands.description: Modifies the rule selector.

commands.name: addRule
commands.description: Creates a new empty rule with the given selector in a special "inspector" stylesheet in the owner document of the context node.

commands.name: getSupportedCSSProperties
commands.description: Returns all supported CSS property names.

commands.name: forcePseudoState

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: The element id for which to force the pseudo state.

parameters.name: forcedPseudoClasses
parameters.description: Element pseudo classes to force when computing the element's style.

commands.description: Ensures that the given node will have specified pseudo-classes whenever its style is computed by the browser.

commands.name: getNamedFlowCollection

parameters.name: documentNodeId
parameters.description: The document node id for which to get the Named Flow Collection.

returns.name: namedFlows
returns.description: An array containing the Named Flows in the document.

commands.description: Returns the Named Flows from the document.

events.name: mediaQueryResultChanged
events.description: Fires whenever a MediaQuery result changes (for example, after a browser window has been resized.) The current implementation considers only viewport-dependent media features.

events.name: styleSheetChanged
events.description: Fired whenever a stylesheet is changed as a result of the client operation.

events.name: namedFlowCreated

parameters.name: namedFlow
parameters.description: The new Named Flow.

events.description: Fires when a Named Flow is created.

events.name: namedFlowRemoved

parameters.name: documentNodeId
parameters.description: The document node id.

parameters.name: flowName
parameters.description: Identifier of the removed Named Flow.

events.description: Fires when a Named Flow is removed: has no associated content nodes and regions.

events.name: regionOversetChanged

parameters.name: namedFlow
parameters.description: The Named Flow containing the regions whose regionOverset values changed.

events.description: Fires if any of the regionOverset values changed in a Named Flow's region chain.

events.name: registeredNamedFlowContentElement

parameters.name: documentNodeId
parameters.description: The document node id.

parameters.name: flowName
parameters.description: Named Flow identifier for which the new content element was registered.

parameters.name: contentNodeId
parameters.description: The node id of the registered content node.

parameters.name: nextContentNodeId
parameters.description: The node id of the element following the registered content node.

events.description: Fires when a Named Flow's has been registered with a new content node.

events.name: unregisteredNamedFlowContentElement

parameters.name: documentNodeId
parameters.description: The document node id.

parameters.name: flowName
parameters.description: Named Flow identifier for which the new content element was unregistered.

parameters.name: contentNodeId
parameters.description: The node id of the unregistered content node.

events.description: Fires when a Named Flow's has been registered with a new content node.

domains.description:
This domain exposes DOM read/write operations. Each DOM Node is represented with its mirror object that has an id. This id can be used to get additional information on the Node, resolve it into the JavaScript object wrapper, etc. It is important that client receives DOM events only for the nodes that are known to the client. Backend keeps track of the nodes that were sent to the client and never sends the same node twice. It is client's responsibility to collect information about the nodes that were sent to the client.

Note that iframe owner elements will return corresponding document elements as their child nodes.

properties.name: nodeId
properties.description: Node identifier that is passed into the rest of the DOM messages as the nodeId. Backend will only push node with given id once. It is aware of all requested nodes and will only fire DOM events for nodes known to the client.

properties.name: children
properties.description: Child nodes of this node when requested with children.

properties.name: attributes
properties.description: Attributes of the Element node in the form of flat array [name1, value1, name2, value2].

properties.name: documentURL
properties.description: Document URL that Document or FrameOwner node points to.

properties.name: baseURL
properties.description: Base URL that Document or FrameOwner node uses for URL completion.

properties.name: xmlVersion
properties.description: Document's XML version in case of XML documents.

properties.name: frameId
properties.description: Frame ID for frame owner elements.

properties.name: contentDocument
properties.description: Content document for frame owner elements.

properties.name: shadowRoots
properties.description: Shadow root list for given element host.

properties.name: templateContent
properties.description: Content document fragment for template elements

properties.name: role
properties.description: Computed value for first recognized role token, default role per element, or overridden role.

types.description: DOM interaction is implemented in terms of mirror objects that represent the actual DOM nodes. DOMNode is a base node mirror type.
A structure holding event listener properties.

properties.name: activeDescendantNodeId
properties.description: DOMNode id of the accessibility object referenced by aria-activedescendant.

properties.name: busy
properties.description: Value of @aria-busy on current or ancestor node.

properties.name: checked
properties.description: Checked state of certain form controls.

properties.name: childNodeIds
properties.description: Array of DOMNode ids of the accessibility tree children if available.

properties.name: controlledNodeIds
properties.description: Array of DOMNode ids of any nodes referenced via @aria-controls.

properties.name: exists
properties.description: Indicates whether there is an existing AX object for the DOM node. If this is false, all the other properties will be default values.

properties.name: flowedNodeIds
properties.description: Array of DOMNode ids of any nodes referenced via @aria-flowto.

properties.name: focused
properties.description: Focused state. Only defined on focusable elements.

properties.name: ignored
properties.description: Indicates whether the accessibility of the associated AX object node is ignored, whether heuristically or explicitly.

properties.name: ignoredByDefault
properties.description: State indicating whether the accessibility of the associated AX object node is ignored by default for node type.

properties.name: hidden
properties.description: Hidden state. True if node or an ancestor is hidden via CSS or explicit @aria-hidden, to clarify why the element is ignored.

properties.name: label
properties.description: Computed label value for the node, sometimes calculated by referencing other nodes.

properties.name: liveRegionRelevant
properties.description: Token value(s) of element's @aria-relevant attribute. Array of string values matching $ref LiveRegionRelevant. FIXME: Enum values blocked by http://webkit.org/b/133711

properties.name: mouseEventNodeId
properties.description: DOMNode id of node or closest ancestor node that has a mousedown, mouseup, or click event handler.

properties.name: ownedNodeIds
properties.description: Array of DOMNode ids of any nodes referenced via @aria-owns.

properties.name: parentNodeId
properties.description: DOMNode id of the accessibility tree parent object if available.

properties.name: role
properties.description: Computed value for first recognized role token, default role per element, or overridden role.

properties.name: selected
properties.description: Selected state of certain form controls.

properties.name: selectedChildNodeIds
properties.description: Array of DOMNode ids of any children marked as selected.

properties.name: r
properties.description: The red component, in the [0-255] range.

properties.name: g
properties.description: The green component, in the [0-255] range.

properties.name: b
properties.description: The blue component, in the [0-255] range.

properties.name: a
properties.description: The alpha component, in the [0-1] range (default: 1).

types.description: A structure holding an RGBA color.
An array of quad vertices, x immediately followed by y for each point, points clock-wise.

properties.name: showInfo
properties.description: Whether the node info tooltip should be shown (default: false).

properties.name: contentColor
properties.description: The content box highlight fill color (default: transparent).

properties.name: paddingColor
properties.description: The padding highlight fill color (default: transparent).

properties.name: borderColor
properties.description: The border highlight fill color (default: transparent).

properties.name: marginColor
properties.description: The margin highlight fill color (default: transparent).

types.description: Configuration data for the highlighting of page elements.

commands.name: getDocument
commands.description: Returns the root DOM node to the caller.

commands.name: requestChildNodes

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: Id of the node to get children for.

parameters.name: depth
parameters.description: The maximum depth at which children should be retrieved, defaults to 1. Use -1 for the entire subtree or provide an integer larger than 0.

commands.description: Requests that children of the node with given id are returned to the caller in form of setChildNodes events where not only immediate children are retrieved, but all children down to the specified depth.

commands.name: querySelector

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: Id of the node to query upon.

parameters.name: selector
parameters.description: Selector string.

commands.description: Executes querySelector on a given node.

commands.name: querySelectorAll

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: Id of the node to query upon.

parameters.name: selector
parameters.description: Selector string.

commands.description: Executes querySelectorAll on a given node.

commands.name: setNodeName

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: Id of the node to set name for.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: New node's name.

commands.description: Sets node name for a node with given id.

commands.name: setNodeValue

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: Id of the node to set value for.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: New node's value.

commands.description: Sets node value for a node with given id.

commands.name: removeNode

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: Id of the node to remove.

commands.description: Removes node with given id.

commands.name: setAttributeValue

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: Id of the element to set attribute for.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Attribute name.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: Attribute value.

commands.description: Sets attribute for an element with given id.

commands.name: setAttributesAsText

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: Id of the element to set attributes for.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: Text with a number of attributes. Will parse this text using HTML parser.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Attribute name to replace with new attributes derived from text in case text parsed successfully.

commands.description: Sets attributes on element with given id. This method is useful when user edits some existing attribute value and types in several attribute name/value pairs.

commands.name: removeAttribute

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: Id of the element to remove attribute from.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the attribute to remove.

commands.description: Removes attribute with given name from an element with given id.

commands.name: getEventListenersForNode

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: Id of the node to get listeners for.

parameters.name: objectGroup
parameters.description: Symbolic group name for handler value. Handler value is not returned without this parameter specified.

commands.description: Returns event listeners relevant to the node.

commands.name: getAccessibilityPropertiesForNode
commands.description: Returns a dictionary of accessibility properties for the node.

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: Id of the node for which to get accessibility properties.

commands.name: getOuterHTML

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: Id of the node to get markup for.

commands.description: Returns node's HTML markup.

commands.name: setOuterHTML

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: Id of the node to set markup for.

parameters.name: outerHTML
parameters.description: Outer HTML markup to set.

commands.description: Sets node HTML markup, returns new node id.

commands.name: performSearch

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Plain text or query selector or XPath search query.

parameters.name: nodeIds
parameters.description: Ids of nodes to use as starting points for the search.

commands.description: Searches for a given string in the DOM tree. Use getSearchResults to access search results or cancelSearch to end this search session.

commands.name: getSearchResults

parameters.name: searchId
parameters.description: Unique search session identifier.

parameters.name: fromIndex
parameters.description: Start index of the search result to be returned.

parameters.name: toIndex
parameters.description: End index of the search result to be returned.

returns.name: nodeIds
returns.description: Ids of the search result nodes.

commands.description: Returns search results from given fromIndex to given toIndex from the sarch with the given identifier.

commands.name: discardSearchResults

parameters.name: searchId
parameters.description: Unique search session identifier.

commands.description: Discards search results from the session with the given id. getSearchResults should no longer be called for that search.

commands.name: requestNode

parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: JavaScript object id to convert into node.

commands.description: Requests that the node is sent to the caller given the JavaScript node object reference. All nodes that form the path from the node to the root are also sent to the client as a series of setChildNodes notifications.

commands.name: setInspectModeEnabled

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: True to enable inspection mode, false to disable it.

parameters.name: highlightConfig
parameters.description: A descriptor for the highlight appearance of hovered-over nodes. May be omitted if enabled == false.

commands.description: Enters the 'inspect' mode. In this mode, elements that user is hovering over are highlighted. Backend then generates 'inspect' command upon element selection.

commands.name: highlightRect

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: X coordinate

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: Y coordinate

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: Rectangle width

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: Rectangle height

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: The highlight fill color (default: transparent).

parameters.name: outlineColor
parameters.description: The highlight outline color (default: transparent).

parameters.name: usePageCoordinates
parameters.description: Indicates whether the provided parameters are in page coordinates or in viewport coordinates (the default).

commands.description: Highlights given rectangle. Coordinates are absolute with respect to the main frame viewport.

commands.name: highlightQuad

parameters.name: quad
parameters.description: Quad to highlight

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: The highlight fill color (default: transparent).

parameters.name: outlineColor
parameters.description: The highlight outline color (default: transparent).

parameters.name: usePageCoordinates
parameters.description: Indicates whether the provided parameters are in page coordinates or in viewport coordinates (the default).

commands.description: Highlights given quad. Coordinates are absolute with respect to the main frame viewport.

commands.name: highlightNode

parameters.name: highlightConfig
parameters.description: A descriptor for the highlight appearance.

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: Identifier of the node to highlight.

parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: JavaScript object id of the node to be highlighted.

commands.description: Highlights DOM node with given id or with the given JavaScript object wrapper. Either nodeId or objectId must be specified.

commands.name: hideHighlight
commands.description: Hides DOM node highlight.

commands.name: highlightFrame

parameters.name: frameId
parameters.description: Identifier of the frame to highlight.

parameters.name: contentColor
parameters.description: The content box highlight fill color (default: transparent).

parameters.name: contentOutlineColor
parameters.description: The content box highlight outline color (default: transparent).

commands.description: Highlights owner element of the frame with given id.

commands.name: pushNodeByPathToFrontend

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Path to node in the proprietary format.

returns.name: nodeId
returns.description: Id of the node for given path.

commands.description: Requests that the node is sent to the caller given its path. // FIXME, use XPath

commands.name: resolveNode

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: Id of the node to resolve.

parameters.name: objectGroup
parameters.description: Symbolic group name that can be used to release multiple objects.

returns.name: object
returns.description: JavaScript object wrapper for given node.

commands.description: Resolves JavaScript node object for given node id.

commands.name: getAttributes

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: Id of the node to retrieve attibutes for.

returns.name: attributes
returns.description: An interleaved array of node attribute names and values.

commands.description: Returns attributes for the specified node.

commands.name: moveTo

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: Id of the node to drop.

parameters.name: targetNodeId
parameters.description: Id of the element to drop into.

parameters.name: insertBeforeNodeId
parameters.description: Drop node before given one.

returns.name: nodeId
returns.description: New id of the moved node.

commands.description: Moves node into the new container, places it before the given anchor.

commands.name: undo
commands.description: Undoes the last performed action.

commands.name: redo
commands.description: Re-does the last undone action.

commands.name: markUndoableState
commands.description: Marks last undoable state.

commands.name: focus

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: Id of the node to focus.

commands.description: Focuses the given element.

events.name: documentUpdated
events.description: Fired when Document has been totally updated. Node ids are no longer valid.

events.name: setChildNodes

parameters.name: parentId
parameters.description: Parent node id to populate with children.

parameters.name: nodes
parameters.description: Child nodes array.

events.description: Fired when backend wants to provide client with the missing DOM structure. This happens upon most of the calls requesting node ids.

events.name: attributeModified

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: Id of the node that has changed.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Attribute name.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: Attribute value.

events.description: Fired when Element's attribute is modified.

events.name: attributeRemoved

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: Id of the node that has changed.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: A ttribute name.

events.description: Fired when Element's attribute is removed.

events.name: inlineStyleInvalidated

parameters.name: nodeIds
parameters.description: Ids of the nodes for which the inline styles have been invalidated.

events.description: Fired when Element's inline style is modified via a CSS property modification.

events.name: characterDataModified

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: Id of the node that has changed.

parameters.name: characterData
parameters.description: New text value.

events.description: Mirrors DOMCharacterDataModified event.

events.name: childNodeCountUpdated

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: Id of the node that has changed.

parameters.name: childNodeCount
parameters.description: New node count.

events.description: Fired when Container's child node count has changed.

events.name: childNodeInserted

parameters.name: parentNodeId
parameters.description: Id of the node that has changed.

parameters.name: previousNodeId
parameters.description: If of the previous siblint.

parameters.name: node
parameters.description: Inserted node data.

events.description: Mirrors DOMNodeInserted event.

events.name: childNodeRemoved

parameters.name: parentNodeId
parameters.description: Parent id.

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: Id of the node that has been removed.

events.description: Mirrors DOMNodeRemoved event.

events.name: shadowRootPushed

parameters.name: hostId
parameters.description: Host element id.

parameters.name: root
parameters.description: Shadow root.

events.description: Called when shadow root is pushed into the element.

events.name: shadowRootPopped

parameters.name: hostId
parameters.description: Host element id.

parameters.name: rootId
parameters.description: Shadow root id.

events.description: Called when shadow root is popped from the element.

properties.name: isLocalStorage
properties.description: Whether the storage is local storage (not session storage).

commands.name: enable
commands.description: Enables storage tracking, storage events will now be delivered to the client.

commands.name: disable
commands.description: Disables storage tracking, prevents storage events from being sent to the client.

commands.name: enable
commands.description: Enables database tracking, database events will now be delivered to the client.

commands.name: disable
commands.description: Disables database tracking, prevents database events from being sent to the client.

types.description: Database with an array of object stores.

properties.name: autoIncrement
properties.description: If true, object store has auto increment flag set.

properties.name: multiEntry
properties.description: If true, index allows multiple entries for a key.

properties.name: lowerOpen
properties.description: If true lower bound is open.

properties.name: upperOpen
properties.description: If true upper bound is open.

commands.name: enable
commands.description: Enables events from backend.

commands.name: disable
commands.description: Disables events from backend.

commands.name: requestDatabaseNames

parameters.name: securityOrigin
parameters.description: Security origin.

commands.description: Requests database names for given security origin.

commands.name: requestDatabase

parameters.name: securityOrigin
parameters.description: Security origin.

parameters.name: databaseName
parameters.description: Database name.

returns.name: databaseWithObjectStores
returns.description: Database with an array of object stores.

commands.description: Requests database with given name in given frame.

commands.name: requestData

parameters.name: securityOrigin
parameters.description: Security origin.

parameters.name: databaseName
parameters.description: Database name.

parameters.name: objectStoreName
parameters.description: Object store name.

parameters.name: indexName
parameters.description: Index name, empty string for object store data requests.

parameters.name: skipCount
parameters.description: Number of records to skip.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Number of records to fetch.

parameters.name: keyRange
parameters.description: Key range.

returns.name: objectStoreDataEntries
returns.description: Array of object store data entries.

returns.name: hasMore
returns.description: If true, there are more entries to fetch in the given range.

commands.description: Requests data from object store or index.

commands.name: clearObjectStore

parameters.name: securityOrigin
parameters.description: Security origin.

parameters.name: databaseName
parameters.description: Database name.

parameters.name: objectStoreName
parameters.description: Object store name.

commands.description: Clears all entries from an object store.

properties.name: layerId
properties.description: The unique id for this layer.

properties.name: nodeId
properties.description: The id for the node associated with this layer.

properties.name: bounds
properties.description: Bounds of the layer in absolute page coordinates.

properties.name: paintCount
properties.description: Indicates how many time this layer has painted.

properties.name: memory
properties.description: Estimated memory used by this layer.

properties.name: compositedBounds
properties.description: The bounds of the composited layer.

properties.name: isInShadowTree
properties.description: Indicates whether this layer is associated with an element hosted in a shadow tree.

properties.name: isReflection
properties.description: Indicates whether this layer was used to provide a reflection for the element.

properties.name: isGeneratedContent
properties.description: Indicates whether the layer is attached to a pseudo element that is CSS generated content.

properties.name: isAnonymous
properties.description: Indicates whether the layer was created for a CSS anonymous block or box.

properties.name: pseudoElementId
properties.description: The id for the pseudo element associated with this layer.

properties.name: pseudoElement
properties.description: The name of the CSS pseudo-element that prompted the layer to be generated.

types.description: An object containing the reasons why the layer was composited as properties.

properties.name: transform3D
properties.description: Composition due to association with an element with a CSS 3D transform.

properties.name: video
properties.description: Composition due to association with a <video> element.

properties.name: canvas
properties.description: Composition due to the element being a <canvas> element.

properties.name: plugin
properties.description: Composition due to association with a plugin.

properties.name: iFrame
properties.description: Composition due to association with an <iframe> element.

properties.name: backfaceVisibilityHidden
properties.description: Composition due to association with an element with a "backface-visibility: hidden" style.

properties.name: clipsCompositingDescendants
properties.description: Composition due to association with an element clipping compositing descendants.

properties.name: animation
properties.description: Composition due to association with an animated element.

properties.name: filters
properties.description: Composition due to association with an element with CSS filters applied.

properties.name: positionFixed
properties.description: Composition due to association with an element with a "position: fixed" style.

properties.name: positionSticky
properties.description: Composition due to association with an element with a "position: sticky" style.

properties.name: overflowScrollingTouch
properties.description: Composition due to association with an element with a "overflow-scrolling: touch" style.

properties.name: stacking
properties.description: Composition due to association with an element establishing a stacking context.

properties.name: overlap
properties.description: Composition due to association with an element overlapping other composited elements.

properties.name: negativeZIndexChildren
properties.description: Composition due to association with an element with descendants that have a negative z-index.

properties.name: transformWithCompositedDescendants
properties.description: Composition due to association with an element with composited descendants.

properties.name: opacityWithCompositedDescendants
properties.description: Composition due to association with an element with opacity applied and composited descendants.

properties.name: maskWithCompositedDescendants
properties.description: Composition due to association with a masked element and composited descendants.

properties.name: reflectionWithCompositedDescendants
properties.description: Composition due to association with an element with a reflection and composited descendants.

properties.name: filterWithCompositedDescendants
properties.description: Composition due to association with an element with CSS filters applied and composited descendants.

properties.name: blendingWithCompositedDescendants
properties.description: Composition due to association with an element with CSS blending applied and composited descendants.

properties.name: isolatesCompositedBlendingDescendants
properties.description: Composition due to association with an element isolating compositing descendants having CSS blending applied.

properties.name: perspective
properties.description: Composition due to association with an element with perspective applied.

properties.name: preserve3D
properties.description: Composition due to association with an element with a "transform-style: preserve-3d" style.

properties.name: root
properties.description: Composition due to association with the root element.

properties.name: blending
properties.description: Composition due to association with an element with a "blend-mode" style.

commands.name: enable
commands.description: Enables compositing tree inspection.

commands.name: disable
commands.description: Disables compositing tree inspection.

commands.name: layersForNode

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: Root of the subtree for which we want to gather layers.

commands.description: Returns the layer tree structure of the current page.

commands.name: reasonsForCompositingLayer

parameters.name: layerId
parameters.description: The id of the layer for which we want to get the reasons it was composited.

commands.description: Provides the reasons why the given layer was composited.

returns.name: compositingReasons
returns.description: An object containing the reasons why the layer was composited as properties.

domains.description: Network domain allows tracking network activities of the page. It exposes information about http, file, data and other requests and responses, their headers, bodies, timing, etc.

types.description: Request / response headers as keys / values of JSON object.

properties.name: navigationStart
properties.description: Timing's navigationStart is a baseline in seconds, while the other numbers are ticks in milliseconds relatively to this navigationStart.

properties.name: connectStart
properties.description: Started connecting to the remote host.

properties.name: url
properties.description: Response URL. This URL can be different from CachedResource.url in case of redirect.

properties.name: mimeType
properties.description: Resource mimeType as determined by the browser.

properties.name: requestHeaders
properties.description: Refined HTTP request headers that were actually transmitted over the network.

properties.name: connectionReused
properties.description: Specifies whether physical connection was actually reused for this request.

properties.name: connectionId
properties.description: Physical connection id that was actually used for this request.

properties.name: fromDiskCache
properties.description: Specifies that the request was served from the disk cache.

properties.name: timing
properties.description: Timing information for the given request.

properties.name: url
properties.description: Resource URL. This is the url of the original network request.

properties.name: sourceMapURL
properties.description: URL of source map associated with this resource (if any).

properties.name: stackTrace
properties.description: Initiator JavaScript stack trace, set for Script only.

properties.name: url
properties.description: Initiator URL, set for Parser type only.

properties.name: lineNumber
properties.description: Initiator line number, set for Parser type only.

commands.name: enable
commands.description: Enables network tracking, network events will now be delivered to the client.

commands.name: disable
commands.description: Disables network tracking, prevents network events from being sent to the client.

commands.name: setExtraHTTPHeaders
commands.description: Specifies whether to always send extra HTTP headers with the requests from this page.

parameters.name: headers
parameters.description: Map with extra HTTP headers.

commands.name: getResponseBody
commands.description: Returns content served for the given request.

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: Identifier of the network request to get content for.

returns.name: base64Encoded
returns.description: True, if content was sent as base64.

commands.name: loadResource

parameters.name: frameId
parameters.description: Frame to load the resource from.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL of the resource to load.

commands.description: Loads a resource in the context of a frame on the inspected page without cross origin checks.

events.name: requestWillBeSent
events.description: Fired when page is about to send HTTP request.

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: Request identifier.

parameters.name: frameId
parameters.description: Frame identifier.

parameters.name: loaderId
parameters.description: Loader identifier.

parameters.name: documentURL

parameters.description: Timestamp.

parameters.name: redirectResponse

parameters.name: type

events.name: requestServedFromCache
events.description: Fired if request ended up loading from cache.

parameters.description: Request identifier.

parameters.name: response
parameters.description: Response data.

events.description: Fired when HTTP request has been served from memory cache.

parameters.description: Loader identifier.

parameters.description: Request initiator.

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: Request identifier.

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: Timestamp.

parameters.name: errorMessage
parameters.description: WebSocket frame error message.

events.name: webSocketFrameSent
events.description: Fired when WebSocket frame is sent.

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: Request identifier.

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: Timestamp.

parameters.name: response
parameters.description: WebSocket response data.

domains.description: Actions and events related to the inspected page belong to the page domain.

types.description: Resource type as it was perceived by the rendering engine.
Coordinate system used by supplied coordinates.
Information about the Frame on the page.

properties.name: loaderId
properties.description: Identifier of the loader associated with this frame.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Frame's name as specified in the tag.

properties.name: mimeType
properties.description: Frame document's mimeType as determined by the browser.

types.description: Information about the Frame hierarchy along with their cached resources.

properties.name: frame
properties.description: Frame information for this tree item.

properties.name: mimeType
properties.description: Resource mimeType as determined by the browser.

properties.name: failed
properties.description: True if the resource failed to load.

properties.name: canceled
properties.description: True if the resource was canceled during loading.

properties.name: sourceMapURL
properties.description: URL of source map associated with this resource (if any).

properties.name: matchesCount
properties.description: Number of matches in the resource content.

properties.name: session
properties.description: True in case of session cookie.

commands.name: enable
commands.description: Enables page domain notifications.

commands.name: disable
commands.description: Disables page domain notifications.

commands.name: reload

parameters.name: ignoreCache
parameters.description: If true, browser cache is ignored (as if the user pressed Shift+refresh).

parameters.name: scriptToEvaluateOnLoad
parameters.description: If set, the script will be injected into all frames of the inspected page after reload.

commands.description: Reloads given page optionally ignoring the cache.

commands.name: navigate

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL to navigate the page to.

commands.description: Navigates current page to the given URL.

commands.name: getCookies
commands.description: Returns all browser cookies. Depending on the backend support, will return detailed cookie information in the cookies field.

commands.name: deleteCookie

parameters.name: cookieName
parameters.description: Name of the cookie to remove.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL to match cooke domain and path.

commands.description: Deletes browser cookie with given name, domain and path.

commands.name: getResourceTree
commands.description: Returns present frame / resource tree structure.

commands.name: getResourceContent
commands.description: Returns content of the given resource.

parameters.name: frameId
parameters.description: Frame id to get resource for.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL of the resource to get content for.

returns.name: base64Encoded
returns.description: True, if content was served as base64.

commands.name: searchInResource
commands.description: Searches for given string in resource content.

parameters.name: frameId
parameters.description: Frame id for resource to search in.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL of the resource to search in.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: String to search for.

parameters.name: caseSensitive
parameters.description: If true, search is case sensitive.

parameters.name: isRegex
parameters.description: If true, treats string parameter as regex.

commands.name: searchInResources
commands.description: Searches for given string in frame / resource tree structure.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: String to search for.

parameters.name: caseSensitive
parameters.description: If true, search is case sensitive.

parameters.name: isRegex
parameters.description: If true, treats string parameter as regex.

commands.name: setDocumentContent
commands.description: Sets given markup as the document's HTML.

parameters.name: frameId
parameters.description: Frame id to set HTML for.

parameters.name: html
parameters.description: HTML content to set.

commands.name: getScriptExecutionStatus
commands.description: Determines if scripts can be executed in the page.

returns.name: result
returns.description: Script execution status: "allowed" if scripts can be executed, "disabled" if script execution has been disabled through page settings, "forbidden" if script execution for the given page is not possible for other reasons.

commands.name: setScriptExecutionDisabled
commands.description: Switches script execution in the page.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: Whether script execution should be disabled in the page.

commands.name: setEmulatedMedia

parameters.name: media
parameters.description: Media type to emulate. Empty string disables the override.

commands.description: Emulates the given media for CSS media queries.

commands.name: getCompositingBordersVisible
commands.description: Indicates the visibility of compositing borders.

returns.name: result
returns.description: If true, compositing borders are visible.

commands.name: setCompositingBordersVisible
commands.description: Controls the visibility of compositing borders.

parameters.name: visible
parameters.description: True for showing compositing borders.

commands.name: snapshotNode
commands.description: Capture a snapshot of the specified node that does not include unrelated layers.

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: Id of the node to snapshot.

commands.name: snapshotRect
commands.description: Capture a snapshot of the page within the specified rectangle and coordinate system.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: X coordinate

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: Y coordinate

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: Rectangle width

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: Rectangle height

parameters.name: coordinateSystem
parameters.description: Indicates the coordinate system of the supplied rectangle.

commands.name: archive
commands.description: Grab an archive of the page.

events.name: frameNavigated
events.description: Fired once navigation of the frame has completed. Frame is now associated with the new loader.

parameters.name: frame
parameters.description: Frame object.

events.name: frameDetached
events.description: Fired when frame has been detached from its parent.

parameters.name: frameId
parameters.description: Id of the frame that has been detached.

events.name: frameStartedLoading
events.description: Fired when frame has started loading.

parameters.name: frameId
parameters.description: Id of the frame that has started loading.

events.name: frameStoppedLoading
events.description: Fired when frame has stopped loading.

parameters.name: frameId
parameters.description: Id of the frame that has stopped loading.

events.name: frameScheduledNavigation
events.description: Fired when frame schedules a potential navigation.

parameters.name: frameId
parameters.description: Id of the frame that has scheduled a navigation.

parameters.name: delay
parameters.description: Delay (in seconds) until the navigation is scheduled to begin. The navigation is not guaranteed to start.

events.name: frameClearedScheduledNavigation
events.description: Fired when frame no longer has a scheduled navigation.

parameters.name: frameId
parameters.description: Id of the frame that has cleared its scheduled navigation.

events.name: javascriptDialogOpening
events.description: Fired when a JavaScript initiated dialog (alert, confirm, prompt, or onbeforeunload) is about to open.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: Message that will be displayed by the dialog.

events.name: javascriptDialogClosed
events.description: Fired when a JavaScript initiated dialog (alert, confirm, prompt, or onbeforeunload) has been closed.

events.name: scriptsEnabled
events.description: Fired when the JavaScript is enabled/disabled on the page

parameters.name: isEnabled
parameters.description: Whether script execution is enabled or disabled on the page.

domains.description: Timeline provides its clients with instrumentation records that are generated during the page runtime. Timeline instrumentation can be started and stopped using corresponding commands. While timeline is started, it is generating timeline event records.

types.description: Timeline record contains information about the recorded activity.

commands.name: start

parameters.name: maxCallStackDepth
parameters.description: Samples JavaScript stack traces up to maxCallStackDepth, defaults to 5.

commands.description: Starts capturing instrumentation events.

commands.name: stop
commands.description: Stops capturing instrumentation events.

events.name: eventRecorded

parameters.name: record
parameters.description: Timeline event record data.

events.description: Fired for every instrumentation event while timeline is started.

events.name: recordingStarted
events.description: Fired when recording has started.

events.name: recordingStopped
events.description: Fired when recording has stopped.
